programme.title: Pirate Traders
programme.desc: Cameras follow treasure hunters the Pirates Inc on high-pressure and often dangerous missions to retrieve and sell valuable items left behind by drug traffickers. In this episode, the team heads to Belize to find a plane when the pilot is jailed.

programme.title: Highway Thru Hell
programme.desc: Al and Gord are called out to deal with a semi teetering on the edge of a 300-foot drop. Jamie gives a new driver a chance, but discovers he may be in over his head.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank visit rural Minnesota, where they meet antiques collectors and examine vintage peep show machines.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank rummage around a machine shop in search of rare collectibles.

programme.title: Alone
programme.desc: The hunt for food becomes paramount as freezing temperatures set in, and the survivalists' desperation forces them to invent ingenious ways of catching dinner.

programme.title: Alone
programme.desc: Ten men plunge into the wilderness with only a backpack, where they are forced to hunt, fend off predators and endure extreme isolation.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick restores a uranium detector and a high school electric scoreboard from the 1940s.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick tries to mend a rare 1940s vacuum cleaner that has fallen to pieces.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts scrutinise the paintings, journals and technical drawings of Leonardo Da Vinci to establish whether they hide evidence of extra-terrestrial beings.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Scientists explore the possibility that sightings of alien beings or UFOs may actually be evidence of time travellers from the future.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Theorists investigate a depiction of a stegosaurus found at Angkor Wat in Cambodia, comtemplating whether it suggest that alien species killed off the dinosaurs.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Danielle search through a scrapyard and a 19th-century ghost town, and find a classic car with a famous Hollywood history.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank find what seems to be a dinosaur bone, and ask the curators of the Museum of Natural Science to verify whether or not it is real.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.sub-title: Welcome to the World of the Sonny Monday
programme.desc: The buyers meet their match in Waxahachie's go-getting locals. Will such stiff competition prevent the team members managing to get their hands on any of the goodies?.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: An auction in Mesquite brings back bad memories for Ricky and Bubba, and Mary makes a strange discovery that leads her to a llama farm.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Things get hairy in Henderson when an impromptu brawl breaks out among some of the bidders.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Jenny makes a series of extravagant bids to come out on top at an auction in Longview.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Veteran locker bidder Puffy - who also happens to be Ricky's mother - causes a commotion when she competes in a storage battle in upscale Haslet.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.sub-title: For the Benefit of Mr Charles
programme.desc: Mary brings a mysterious friend to an auction, and Jenny adopts a bold new strategy.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell bets everything on the unknown contents of a locker in Harbor City.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The bidders go to Santa Cruz for one of the most hotly anticipated auctions of the year.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Jarrod and Brandi discover a secret in San Francisco, while Darrell takes a gamble that could cost him everything.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell hopes that his instincts will put him back in profit, while Dave has trouble finding anything worth bidding for.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The bidders head to Torrance and compete over an unusual unit that may prove to be one of the most valuable in the series' history.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: At auctions in Bellflower, Ivy prays he can salvage something from a bad purchase. Meanwhile, Jarrod buys a unit that proves a nightmare for Brandi..

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Ivy knows exactly what he wants at an auction in Fontana and has high hopes of getting it, while Jarrod and Brandi need to work on their tactics.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: The Thrill of a Kitty and the Agony of Smoked Meat
programme.desc: Darrell aims to prove that treasure sometimes looks like total trash, while Rene won't be content with second best.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers head to West Covina in California, where Jarrod and Brandi bring in an expert to sniff out the best lockers and Darrell and Brandon help everyone dress for success.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Mary faces stiff opposition as she tries to turn a bad day around with a great locker, as everyone is out to make big bucks at auctions in Riverside.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Most Wanted
programme.desc: Dog the Bounty Hunter spin-off. Beth has been diagnosed with cancer but is determined to keep working, so the team travel to Hawaii to hunt down a fugitive.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: After forging friction folders from a steel coil, finalists must create a blade that requires both precision and detail: the French smallsword.

programme.title: The Curse of Civil War Gold
programme.desc: Kevin Dykstra and Marty Lagina base their search for Civil War gold in at the bottom of Lake Michigan on a deathbed confession from a lighthouse keeper in the 1890s.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Part one of two. All hell breaks loose when Ashley puts a rare Olympic torch from Seth's personal collection up for sale.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Part two of two. Ashley faces the consequences of her rash decision, Seth takes a ride in a hovercraft and Les does business with Muhammad Ali Jr.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les offers to buy a diamond-encrusted watch from a customer. He makes sure his jewellery expert takes a close look, having been stung by a similar deal previously.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The price of gold continues to drop. Seth suggests they should review their purchases, and sort out the cluttered sales floor, along with a warehouse overloaded with junk.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.sub-title: Have I Got a Bit More Old News for You
programme.desc: Jo Brand hosts an extended edition of the satirical quiz, with comedy actress and writer Diane Morgan and Countdown host Nick Hewer joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the week's news stories.

programme.title: Dave Gorman: Modern Life Is Goodish
programme.desc: Dave Gorman asks just how gullible people are as he looks at film marketing, and whether celebrities really can sell anything.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: David Tennant hosts the satirical news quiz, with guests Phil Wang and Janet Street-Porter joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton.

programme.title: Judge Romesh
programme.desc: A fed-up claimant appears in court to stop his friend climbing on their roof and a teacher accuses a colleague of theft in a dramatic legal showdown.

programme.title: Judge Romesh
programme.desc: A real-life superhero appears in the dock after a friend has concerns for his safety, while a spider-obsessed defendant is in danger of losing his girlfriend.

programme.title: Crackanory
programme.desc: An illusionist performs his 'the lady vanishes' act rather too well and wonders if he has genuine magic powers. Mackenzie Crook spins this twisted yarn.

programme.title: Crackanory
programme.desc: A hapless former aristocrat stumbles upon an old house with a strange inhabitant. Miriam Margolyes narrates.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Hurricane Man
programme.desc: Josh attempts to get inside Super Typhoon Yutu, the strongest storm of 2018, arriving in the Philippines just as the typhoon starts to bring down power lines.

programme.title: Steve Austin's Broken Skull Challenge
programme.desc: The former wrestler challenges eight contestants to triumph over a series of gruelling physical endurance tests.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Dozens of amateur racers hurtle through the Chilean capital of Santiago, with only gravity propelling their wacky homemade vehicles.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: In a first for the show, James May shocks the rest of the team when he puts his foot firmly on the accelerator of a Bugatti Veyron. Meanwhile, a case of bad driving and appalling trousers results in all three presenters getting thrown off a golf course. Actor Hugh Grant is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Steve and Tim head up the night shift as they deal with an array of inebriated locals in Burton. Documentary series following the work of the Staffordshire Police force.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: In Stoke, a suspected stolen car leads to a high-speed chase in the early hours of the morning. Documentary series following the work of the Staffordshire Police force.

programme.title: Drug Wars
programme.desc: Broward County law enforcement and fire rescue tackle cases tied to the dangerous new synthetic drug Flakka, and an addict undertakes what may be his last chance at recovery.

programme.title: Drug Wars
programme.desc: When night falls on South Texas, the Rio Grande comes to life with drug smugglers. Border Patrol counters this by dispatching highly-trained Special Operations units.

programme.title: Aussie Pickers
programme.desc: Lucas and Adam visit a huge collection of military items and vehicles just outside of Melbourne.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike takes an epic Route 66 road trip in an antique convertible to return it to the widow of its previous owner.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner welcomes Pointless co-host Richard Osman, broadcaster Joan Bakewell and comedian Roisin Conaty to discuss their pet hates, in the hope of having them banished to Room 101. Their gripes include Bambi, chewing gum and cobblers.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: German comedian Henning Wehn, West End star Michael Ball and actress-presenter Caroline Quentin reveal their pet hates to Frank Skinner, in the hope he will banish them to Room 101. Things that really get on the guests' nerves this week include fundraising, clairvoyants and junk mail.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: TV presenter Vernon Kay, interior designer and Dragons' Den entrepreneur Kelly Hoppen, and comedian and actor Miles Jupp compete to have their pet hates banished on the lively panel show chaired by Frank Skinner. Their gripes include litter louts, toilet-roll covers and loud noises.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Dozens of amateur racers hurtle through the Chilean capital of Santiago, with only gravity propelling their wacky homemade vehicles.

programme.title: Border Force: America's Gatekeepers
programme.desc: Vigilant Customs and Border Protection officers uncover 5,000 rounds of ammunition being smuggled across Hidalgo Bridge into Mexico.

programme.title: Border Force: America's Gatekeepers
programme.desc: Officers face a harrowing situation as a family from Venezuela pleads with them to enter America. In Progreso, a suspected drug dealer is caught smuggling pills in his underpants.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Actor, writer and TV presenter Richard Ayoade takes over the reins for an extended edition of the satirical quiz, with Pointless co-host Richard Osman and comedian Kiri Pritchard-McLean joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.sub-title: QI XL: Pubs - A Christmas Special
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig has a Christmas knees-up in the pub with Alan Davies, Cariad Lloyd, Josh Widdicombe and Noel Fielding. Pub-themed questions are the order of the day, with a sprinkling of festive cheer along the way.

programme.title: The Misadventures of Romesh Ranganathan
programme.desc: The comedian visits Ethiopia, where anthropologist Mike Tamerat shows him a side of the country in stark contrast to the common public image of a nation devastated by famine. Romesh experiences local traditional medicine and jazz music, as well as learning more about the country's oppressive political regime that has led to decades of turmoil for a country that stands on the brink of a new era in its history.

programme.title: Chris Tarrant: Extreme Railway Journeys
programme.sub-title: Chris Tarrant on the Polar Express
programme.desc: Chris sets out to reach the northernmost railway station on Earth, inside Russia's Arctic Circle. This is an epic 2,000-mile adventure from Moscow into Arctic Siberia, and begins with a marathon 19-hour leg. Along the way he enjoys a reindeer stew with a local family and takes the controls of one of the massive locomotives that power the trains, before pressing on along railways built under the brutal regime of Joseph Stalin.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: New York Architect Wendy Fok travels to the remote Guizhou Valley in China to see the Beipanjiang First Bridge, the highest bridge on Earth, which boasts a 20,000 tonne steel deck. She soon discovers that trying to straddle a 565 metre gorge so deep that it's known as the 'crack in the Earth', presented huge challenges for its engineers. Plus, Andrew Steele tracks down a bridge on the thames that nobody thought could ever be built, Suzie Sheehy is in Hampshire climbing the tallest unreinforced concrete town ever built and Luke Bisby scales the Forth Bridge in Edinburgh.

programme.title: The British Middle Class
programme.desc: Historian and broadcaster Tristram Hunt examines the social class's origins. He discovers how the backlash against the landed aristocracy began with a group of radical thinkers who craved progress and used their money from industry to begin a process of urban enlightenment. However, the growth of mass production led the newly moneyed leaders to move further away from the factories, beginning the trend for suburban living as a mark of status - though it meant the middle classes turning their back on where they came from.

programme.title: Ronnie Kray and the Pervert Peer
programme.desc: Fifty years ago, the Kray twins rose from small-time racketeers to head the most powerful criminal organisation London had ever seen. This documentary about the affinity between the upper echelons of society and the criminal underclass reveals how they built their empire on fear, violence and extortion - as well as Ronnie's alleged homosexual relationship with a prominent Tory peer.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.sub-title: Walking Through History: Nazi Occupation - Channel Islands
programme.desc: Tony Robinson heads to Guernsey and Jersey to tell the story of the islands' surrender to the Nazis during the Second World War. In Guernsey, he hears of the first bombing raid that heralded the German troops' arrival and sees the spot where the first-ever British commando landed in secret, only to see the planned revenge raid fail spectacularly. A ferry then takes him on to Jersey, where he finds almost all of its beaches have a bunker or a machine gun post left over from the conflict.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.sub-title: Walking Through History: King John's Ruin - Peak District
programme.desc: As the 800th anniversary of the signing of Magna Carta in June 1215 approaches, Tony Robinson sets out to discover the real King John. His walk across the medieval monarch's stamping grounds of Sherwood Forest and the Peak District reveals a hapless man stumbling from crisis to crisis who, in the end, had no choice but to sign away some of his power. In the midst of what are now cultivated fields, Tony finds the scant remains of Laxton Castle, once the control centre where strict 'forest law' was administered and where taxes and fines flooded into the royal coffers. Later, in Sherwood, he explores how the myth of Robin Hood has helped to skew the public's image of King John.

programme.title: True Evil: The Making of a Nazi
programme.desc: A look at Wernher von Braun, the gifted young scientist whose ambition led him to abandon any sense of morality in pursuit of his dream of space flight.

programme.title: True Evil: The Making of a Nazi
programme.desc: Heinrich Himmler, the book-loving loner whose strange mystical beliefs drove him to carry out the most shocking act of genocide in human history.

programme.title: True Evil: The Making of a Nazi
programme.desc: Albert Speer, the apolitical architect whose desire to build grand buildings led him to sell his soul.

programme.title: True Evil: The Making of a Nazi
programme.desc: A profile of Adolf Eichmann, the talented bureaucratic civil servant whose robotic willingness to follow orders led him to design the system that would bring about the holocaust.

programme.title: True Evil: The Making of a Nazi
programme.desc: A profile of Hermann Goering - the dashing, young, down-on-his-luck war veteran who turned into an extravagant, heartless, obese, drug-addled Nazi billionaire.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: How Europe's most advanced power station became a film set. Plus, the structures made by scientific pioneer Nikola Tesla in his quest to provide the US with free electricity.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The stories behind closed roads, including a route once used by the French Resistance and areas made impassable by crumbling hills and sand dunes.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A fuel plant in Poland built to make Nazi Germany self-sufficient by using the latest technology of the time to turn coal into oil.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The creation of a set of Second World War sea defences built near the mouth of the River Thames to protect London. Plus, a concrete pyramid build during the Cold War.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: Examining the 1966 murders of three police officers in Shepherd's Bush that led to a huge manhunt and calls for the death penalty to be reinstated.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: Part one of two. A re-examination of Jack the Ripper's crimes, revealing how the story known today was shaped by the sensationalist press of 1888. This documentary strips back decades of rumour and misinformation to reveal the true lives of the five women slain.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: In 1879, widow Julia Martha Thomas was killed in her own home by her servant. The death of struck at the heart of Victorian society, at the sanctity of the home and the rigid divides between the classes, for Kate Webster did not only kill and dismember her employer - she stole her clothes, her property and her identity.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: Edith accepts Monsieur Alfonse's proposal of marriage, much to the dismay of Rene, who realises he stands to lose the cafe if she ties the knot.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: Michelle concocts another plan to infiltrate German headquarters and rescue the British airmen using hijacked German uniforms, but who will they fit?.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: Double-length episode, originally shown at Christmas 1986. The Resistance plan to steal a plane to fly the airmen back to Britain. A parade of antique vehicles is arranged as a diversion, while Rene works on an unusual means of launching the aircraft.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Dave finds a very rare 70s Sunbeam Lotus that has been rotting away in a farmyard for 29 years, while a Morris Minor convertible goes under the hammer.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Forgotten relics from the defence of America's homeland, concealed by the banks of the Mississippi, and a concrete behemoth on the French coast that proved invulnerable to attacks.

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: Julia is assigned a compensation case brought by a man who has sustained spinal and brain damage in an accident at work, and tries to persuade Kavanagh to lead her. Unfortunately, he already has his hands full with a tricky compensation case and son Matt's attempts to get the better of him. John Thaw stars, with Ned Sherrin, Frances Tomelty and TP McKenna.

programme.title: The White Princess
programme.desc: Sequel to The White Queen, set in the Middle Ages and picking up as the tumultuous War of the Roses comes to an end, a new generation ascends to the throne in a tale of power, political clashes, family, love and betrayal. As the victor of the Battle of Bosworth, Henry Tudor, is set to ascend the throne and Elizabeth of York and her family, supporters of the former King, find themselves in grave danger. Lizzie must fulfil her promise to marry King Henry VII and bring peace to the nation. Jodie Comer, Jacob Collins-Levy, Suki Waterhouse and Michelle Fairley star.

programme.title: Cadfael
programme.desc: The annual St Peter's Fair gets under way in Shrewsbury but a gruesome murder dampens the festivities. Antagonism between local merchants and visiting traders becomes increasingly ugly, and as civil unrest rages in the streets, Beringar is ordered to kill his friend Cadfael, whose investigations are causing King Stephen acute political embarrassment. Medieval whodunit, starring Derek Jacobi, Eoin McCarthy and Michael Culver.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Doctor Finlay
programme.desc: After Alex Grant's death, it emerges his daughter Rachel has been incarcerated in an asylum for 30 years for having an illegitimate child. Janet is determined to secure her release, but Dr Cameron doubts the wisdom of her efforts. Drama, starring David Rintoul, Ian Bannen and Annette Crosbie.

programme.title: Doctor Finlay
programme.desc: The renovation of Arden House gets under way, but Dr Finlay begins to wonder if it was such a good idea when Dr Neil becomes increasingly vexed. Meanwhile, Janet grapples with her own problems and Dr Cameron's night-time call-out is tinged with tragedy. Medical drama, starring David Rintoul.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Andrea fights to save her relationship and reputation by exposing Gabriel as the Sun Hill sniper - but editor Bruce Malcolm has other ideas. Dale reprimands Colin Fairfax for his racist attitude, while Samantha gives evidence at the trial of serial rapist Alan Kennedy and manages to outmanoeuvre a defence QC who accuses her of securing a confession by means of psychological torture.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Andrea's cover has been well and truly blown, leaving her to face the wrath of Gina and fatally compromising her testimony at the trial of rapist Alan Kennedy, who is acquitted. Desperate for a chance to redeem herself, she makes one last effort to gather incriminating evidence against Gabriel - only to end up being held hostage in a store room by the crazed copper. Events come to a head when Colin is dismissed after being exposed as a vicious racist and retaliates by handcuffing Ken in a petrol-doused van and crashing it into Sun Hill's front office. Blissfully unaware of the escalating crisis, Reg calls Marilyn's mobile phone at the station, intending to ask for her hand in marriage - and triggers a massive explosion.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: An inferno sweeps through Sun Hill station in the aftermath of the explosion, giving Gabriel the chance to make good his escape, callously leaving Andrea trapped under fallen debris as the flames creep closer. Dale also faces a fiery demise in the burning building, while Jim struggles to accept the news that his friend Ken was killed instantly when the van blew up. Marilyn fights for life in hospital, a grief-stricken Reg at her bedside - and as he tearfully slips an engagement ring onto her finger, an ominous bleep from her cardiac monitor heralds a tragic end to their relationship.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Kezia and Smithy work together on a courier van hijack and soon get a result, but later find themselves in trouble for scaring one of Keith Durante's rape victims. James Tennant's fiancee turns up at the station with news that he has evidence of the whereabouts of his missing daughter Amy, but it's clear that seven months of frantic searching have left him a broken man.

programme.title: Hetty Wainthropp Investigates
programme.desc: A forgetful clock-mender contacts the sleuth when he becomes the target of a couple of small-time crooks. Armed with advice from DCI Adams, Hetty starts her investigation at a video store and soon discovers that there is more to the case than meets the eye.

programme.title: Hetty Wainthropp Investigates
programme.desc: Now that Hetty and her husband are back from their trip to Australia, the Wainthropp Detective Agency can get back to some serious sleuthing. However, the first case to crop up is far from typical - it involves hunting for buried treasure in the wilds of Cumbria. Patricia Routledge stars as the modern-day Miss Marple, with Derek Benfield, Dominic Monaghan and Lesley Dunlop.

programme.title: Cranford
programme.desc: Change is on the way to the sleepy market town of Cranford as the railway pushes out from Manchester, but many of the female residents are more excited about the arrival of the handsome new doctor, Frank Harrison. Adapted by Heidi Thomas, with an all-star cast including Judi Dench and Eileen Atkins, who was awarded a Bafta for her role as the authoritative Miss Deborah Jenkyns.

programme.title: Cranford
programme.desc: The town's residents prepare for Lady Ludlow's garden party, but the occasion is marred by rumours the railway line will come right into Cranford, leaving Deborah feeling betrayed. Dr Harrison's plans to become better acquainted with Sophy are thwarted by Caroline Tomkinson and Clara Smith, Mr Carter takes pity on an illiterate 10-year-old and Miss Matty is shaken to see a face from her past. Starring Judi Dench, Michael Gambon and Eileen Atkins.

programme.title: Cranford
programme.desc: Christmas arrives in the town, but Lady Ludlow regrets any notion of seasonal charity when Mr Carter asks her to intervene in the case of Job Gregson, who has been blamed for a spate of thefts. Miss Matty is delighted when Mr Holbrook invites her to his farm, and Dr Harrison's friend Jack sends Caroline Tomkinson a card hinting she should expect a proposal from the medic. Starring Judi Dench, Michael Gambon and Philip Glenister.

programme.title: Cranford
programme.desc: Miss Matty confides in Mary about Mr Holbrook's death, prompting her to inform Major Gordon of Jessie's regret over not marrying him. Dr Harrison tells Rev Hutton of his intentions toward Sophy and asks permission to court her, blissfully unaware that the generosity he has shown to Mrs Rose has accidentally created an unlikely love triangle. Penultimate episode of the costume drama, starring Judi Dench and Simon Woods.

programme.title: Cranford
programme.desc: The true nature of friendship within Cranford is revealed as the ladies rally to help Miss Matty when she receives terrible news. Meanwhile, Dr Harrison suffers as his career, reputation and relationship all seem ruined, while Miss Galindo and Mr Carter grow closer as they face up to the tragedy of Hanbury. Judi Dench, Philip Glenister and Simon Woods star.

programme.title: Miss Marple
programme.desc: The shrewd spinster is sent to convalesce in the tropical paradise of Barbados, where she finds life decidedly dull - until a grisly double murder breaks the monotony and presents her with an unforeseen opportunity to do some serious sleuthing. Feature-length mystery, starring Joan Hickson, Donald Pleasence and Adrian Lukis.

programme.title: The Casual Vacancy
programme.desc: Drama adapted from the novel by JK Rowling, set in an English village whose seemingly idyllic facade hides a community at war. At the parish council meeting, chairman Howard Mollison introduces his plans to turn the community centre into a health spa, but he reckons without local solicitor Barry Fairbrother, who makes an impassioned speech about the importance of the centre to the impoverished people of the nearby estate. However, an unexpected turn of events leaves an empty seat on the council - leading to the biggest battle Pagford has ever seen. Michael Gambon, Rory Kinnear, Keeley Hawes and Julia McKenzie star.

programme.title: The Last Post
programme.desc: Christmas comes to Aden, and the RMP receive some welcome news as romance blossoms between Armstrong and Yusra. Markham is concerned that the photographs taken by Martha could cause a scandal, and sends Joe to retrieve them - but he finds himself dangerously attracted to her. Ed confesses to Alison that he knows about her secret as they try to reconnect in the wake of a recent tragedy.

programme.title: The Magnificent Seven (2016)
programme.desc: A remote frontier town falls under the control of a ruthless industrialist, who uses the locals as forced labour in his mines. A woman goes in search of help, recruiting a band of seven hired guns to protect the town and train the people to fight back. Remake of the classic Western, starring Denzel Washington and Chris Pratt.

programme.title: Teach My Pet to Do That
programme.desc: Animal lover, comedian and presenter Alexander Armstrong opens the doors of his multispecies pet training school to welcome Ethel the goat and Fagin the crow, in the hope they can learn to tidy up their toys and put them away in a box. The week's star pupil is Smurf, a Parson Russell terrier who holds the world record of performing the most tricks in a minute. The trainers hit the road to teach an Arab mare called Ruby Ribena to count in the hope she can help turn a little girl's party into a fairy tale.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Thunderbirds Are Go
programme.desc: Part two of two. International Rescue faces their most dangerous mission ever when Tracy Island comes under attack. Guest starring Lee Majors (The Six Million Dollar Man).

credits.actor: Lee Majors (The Six Million Dollar Man)

programme.title: Dare Master
programme.desc: Danny's dare is to drive a tank blindfolded. Can he get across the course and knock down the cardboard box wall?.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo thinks that Fizz is a hat he is going to wear for his romantic date with Marnie. That's bad enough, but Fizz has a very important job to do!.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: At the supermarket, Magoo mixes his shopping cart up with a baby stroller. Fizz decides to save the toddler and become a media star..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo thinks Weasel has opened a restaurant, and wants to help him improve it. He mistakes the FizzLab for a kitchen!.

programme.title: Scrambled!
programme.desc: Two hours of children's fun and entertainment.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mrs. Wicket demands Mr. Bean drive her and Miss Wince to the spa, and wait outside until they're done. But Bean gets bored, and looks for fun!.

programme.title: Kung Fu Panda: The Paws of Destiny
programme.sub-title: Out of the Cave and onto Thin Ice
programme.desc: Po sets out to get his chi back and Jing resolves to face Jindiao after a shocking revelation..

programme.title: Craig of the Creek
programme.desc: Craig of the Creek follows a young boy and his two friends as they go on adventures in a world of untamed, kid-dominated wilderness in the creek.

programme.title: Ainsley's Caribbean Kitchen
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott takes a culinary tour of Dominica, taking a trip into the wild rainforests to the island's most famous waterfall. He prepares twice-fried plantains on the black sands of Picard Beach, discovers a local recipe using tiny fish that gather in Dominica's rivers, and acquires some cassava bread from the Kalinago community, to serve with his Calypso chicken.

programme.title: Living on the Veg
programme.desc: Henry Firth and Ian Theasby serve up their version of classic Chinese dish crispy duck pancakes, and follow it up with spicy cauli wings with ranch sauce, a herby stew, and their pain au chococake. Their guest is chef Luke Robinson, who prepares miso glazed aubergine.

programme.title: The Voice UK
programme.desc: Emma Willis hosts the second episode of the Battle rounds. Coaches will.i.am, Sir Tom Jones, Olly Murs and Meghan Trainor all return to their infamous red chairs as the acts they have chosen from the blind auditions go head to head and fight for their place on their coach's team. The singers that impress their coach the most remain in the competition, but those that aren't so lucky can still be stolen by another coach.

programme.title: Ant & Dec's Saturday Night Takeaway
programme.desc: The popular duo's entertainment show, featuring undercover pranks, surprises galore and star guests. In this week's show, Ant and Dec are joined in the studio by Rob Brydon, who takes up the role of Star Guest Announcer, while Anne-Marie will be taking to the stage to perform in the End Of The Show Show. Plus, lucky viewers across the UK are surprised with a Place On The Plane and another audience member gets the chance to Win The Ads, and get their hands on every single item featured in the commercial breaks.

programme.title: Uncle Buck (1989)
programme.desc: An unreliable but good-natured slob is called upon to look after his trouble-making nephew and nieces while their parents are away - and what starts as a disaster soon changes for the better as the unlikely babysitter gets to grips with the finer points of being a responsible adult. Family comedy, starring John Candy, Macaulay Culkin, Jean Kelly, Gaby Hoffman, Amy Madigan and Laurie Metcalf.

programme.title: Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts the game show, asking Strictly Come Dancing professional Oti Mabuse, tennis coach Judy Murray and actor-comedian John Thomson to guess the familiar phrases hidden in animated clues. One of them will make it through to the Super Catchphrase round, where they could win 50,000 for the charity of their choice.

programme.title: Dancing on Ice
programme.desc: Phillip Schofield and Holly Willoughby host the semi-final of the skating contest, in which the celebrities must each perform two routines for judges Jayne Torvill, Christopher Dean, Ashley Banjo and John Barrowman in the hope of winning a place in next week's grand final. Plus, a performance by Cirque du Soleil: Crystal.

programme.title: McDonald & Dodds
programme.sub-title: The Fall of the House of Crockett
programme.desc: Mystery drama set in Bath, where the wildly ambitious DCI McDonald finds herself paired with the shy, modest DS Dodds, who has languished on the shelf for most of his working life. However, it soon turns out the unassuming sergeant has a hidden talent for puzzle solving. Their first case sees the pair looking into the shooting of a homeless man in the deserted mansion of local industrialist Max Crockett. The Crockett appear to be a close-knit group but it soon becomes clear they have secrets to hide. Jason Watkins and Tala Gouveia star as the detectives, with a guest appearance from Robert Lindsay.

programme.title: Harry Redknapp's Sandbanks Summer
programme.desc: Harry Redknapp welcomes celebrity friends to his house in Sandbanks, Britain's most exclusive and expensive seaside resort. In this episode, Harry welcomes John Barnes and Chris Kamara, where they take to the water to see what the area has to offer from the sea. Harry challenges John and Chris to a powerboat showdown on the Solent, before they sample a local delicacy at Harry's favourite chip shop.

programme.title: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Documentary looking at crash-for-cash scams, joy riders and brazen car thieves - with dramatic video and interviews from victims and eyewitnesses. Police officers reveal how they catch the criminals, and former car thieves expose the tactics used to take vehicles. Narrated by Jamie Theakston.

programme.title: Heathrow: Britain's Busiest Airport
programme.desc: Documentary going behind the scenes of the airport. Staff at Heathrow airport contend with drunken passengers, drugs and drones, while Sue and Demi deal with an extra load of passengers after a closure at Gatwick airport. Elsewhere, Border Force officer Bob returns to the job, working to protect Britain's biggest border.

programme.desc: Action from the Marrakesh ePrix.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: Rookie team the Young Guns have a life-threatening moment hunting legendary pineapple opal. The Cooke Bros scramble to hunt on another miner's claim for a share of the find.

programme.title: Supertruckers
programme.desc: Heavy haulage driver Tom leads a convoy of three Giant Dumper Trucks, each weighing 77 tonnes and worth a million pounds, on an epic 680km journey from Somerset to Derbyshire.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: Part two of two. The team continues work for an outdoor lifestyle company, while the Teutuls travel to Brazil to visit the Presidential Palace.

programme.title: Fantomworks
programme.desc: When George brings his 1971 Mustang Mach 1, Dan realises that his car has been jumped, Dukes of Hazzard-style. Mick seeks help to restore his 1952 Mercury Woody.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer plans to capitalise on 1980s nostalgia by restoring an original 1982 Toyota Supra, and Ant Anstead works to bring this 35-year-old car into the modern era.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: The making of robotic hunting decoys, tinned tomatoes, scoreboards and lassos, and how technology has influenced their production.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: The making of turf grass, beef jerky, wood chippers and bowling pins.

programme.title: Expedition Mungo
programme.desc: Wildlife cameraman Paul 'Mungo' Mungeam heads to Peru to capture on film the legendary yacumama - a snake so feared by villagers that they have tried to blow it up with dynamite.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole tries to restore a monkey bike, and Simon O'Brien makes use of all his skills as he tries to give new life to an old racing bicycle.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Modern day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard travels the length and breadth of the UK in search of weird and wonderful objects.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer plans to capitalise on 1980s nostalgia by restoring an original 1982 Toyota Supra, and Ant Anstead works to bring this 35-year-old car into the modern era.

programme.title: EFL on Quest
programme.desc: Colin Murray presents a round-up of goals and highlights from the English Football League, including Hull City v Leeds United and West Bromwich Albion v Wigan Athletic.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz unleash a sleek '67 Jaguar in a New Jersey garage and later pick a general store with a Presidential past.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Danielle join an architectural salvage crew on a special mission, while Robbie and Frank hunt for treasure in an old theatre-turned-prop warehouse.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz head to Minnesota on a rescue mission to help save the remains of a carnival business from Mother Nature.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: In the middle of a Minnesota blizzard Mike and Frank face the frost to uncover a rare pair of trucks on farmer Jim's spread. Series following the lives of Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz, two of America's most skilled 'pickers', who travel around the country trawling junk yards, garages, attics and barns for precious objects.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Ploughing through a 40-acre salvage yard, junk experts Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz harvest a few lost treasures, including a never-before-seen farmer's mini-bike.

programme.title: Fantomworks
programme.desc: Larry wants to drive his uncle's '59 Cadillac DeVille, but the car has spent decades baking in the sun. Plus, a 1960 Bel Air is still missing critical components.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer travels to America in search of a Willys Jeep, but the vehicle he finds needs major repairs and high transport costs to the UK could jeopardise his making a profit.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole tries to restore a monkey bike, and Simon O'Brien makes use of all his skills as he tries to give new life to an old racing bicycle.

programme.title: Born Mucky: Life on the Farm
programme.desc: Tom seeks expert help to save one of his ancient hedgerows. Meanwhile, Ian has a loose pig on his hands when one of them escapes during weigh-in and Ally runs out of storage.

programme.title: Carabao Cup on Quest
programme.desc: Colin Murray introduces highlights of the Carabao Cup final between Aston Villa and Manchester City at Wembley Stadiiumm.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Modern day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard travels the length and breadth of the UK in search of weird and wonderful objects.

programme.title: You Asked to See the Monster
programme.desc: The traumatic and shocking story of Gary Green, who killed his wife Lovetta Armstead and her six-year-old daughter Jazzmen Montgomery, shortly after Lovetta had requested a divorce.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: A Miami river washes up a torso, leaving baffled investigators with the gruesome task of locating missing body parts and trying to determine whether the victim was male or female.

programme.title: Crime Stories
programme.desc: The case of Russian immigrant Iouri Mikhel, who ran a kidnap-for-ransom scheme that resulted in the deaths of five people in California between 2000 and 2001.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The case of retired teacher Margaret Jack Sliger, shot dead in her farmyard in Mooresburg in May 2015. Kyle Robert Wolfe, a 15-year-old boy, later pleaded guilty to the crime.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The hunt for a killer who preyed on senior citizens in the town of River Parish, Louisiana, during the spring of 1997.

programme.title: Animal Cops Phoenix
programme.desc: Emergency animal medical technician AJ Meadows battles to save seven dogs locked in an overheated car with no food or water.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Chris Brown and Lisa Chimes head out to the Blue Mountains after some of the most intense bushfires on record, to help pets and wildlife in the fire zone.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A woman returns a ballroom-style dress so that she can buy one that better suits her edgy tastes.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Mike Sorrentino arrives at Kleinfeld to help Melissa find her wedding gown. However, Mike and his brothers steal the spotlight.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A customer fears her father will not approve of her dress, while another bride and her pushy dad try to find the perfect gown.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Chris Brown meets a cormorant missing half its beak, and practice makes perfect for some budding vets. A dog has a hip problem - and there is only one way to fix it.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown deals with Fergus, the accident-prone dog, and Brian, the bulldog who is struggling to breathe. Tim attempts to tackle some runaway sheep.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Part one of two. Liz is bed-bound with severe lymphedema making it impossible to walk. Isolated, friendless and depressed she lives with her mother, who is too ill to care for her.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Part one of two. Liz is bed-bound with severe lymphedema making it impossible to walk. Isolated, friendless and depressed she lives with her mother, who is too ill to care for her.

programme.title: My 600lb Life: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: Charity managed to lose over 400 pounds, but now her daughter Charly is becoming dangerously obese. Can Charity help her avoid the same fate?.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of 36-year-old Air Force veteran Michael VanZandt. When he vanished in March 2016, California police suspected a random attacker, but his relatives were haunted by his thrill-seeking when considering his fate.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Big Bliss
programme.desc: A bride is having a Batman-themed wedding and wants a dress inspired by her favourite villain, while another customer has high expectations for her gown.

programme.title: Curvy Brides Boutique
programme.desc: Behind the scenes at a wedding dress shop catering to larger customers. A self-conscious bride presents a challenge, and another customer has high expectations.

programme.title: Curvy Brides Boutique
programme.desc: Lacey is getting married to her childhood sweetheart, but is terrified of walking down the aisle. Experts Jo and Al try to help her to overcome her insecurities.

programme.title: Curvy Brides Boutique
programme.desc: Bride-to-be Rachel plans to celebrate her sizeable assets with a strapless wedding dress. The design proves too bold for Al and Jo, who try to persuade her to try a more subtle look.

programme.title: Curvy Brides Boutique
programme.desc: A customer is determined to wear a red wedding dress - but as the big day draws closer, she begins to have second thoughts.

programme.title: Curvy Brides Boutique
programme.desc: A customer fears she has been overeating since she last tried on her dream dress, while Jo and Al have a demanding entourage on their hands.

programme.title: Little People, Big World
programme.desc: Zach misses out on the opportunity to meet girls his own age and height, and decides to play football with his friends instead.

programme.title: Little People, Big World
programme.desc: Matt and Amy go on a cruise, but are not prepared for what awaits them on their return home.

programme.title: My Cat from Hell
programme.desc: Behaviourist Jackson Galaxy works with a Bengal that keeps spraying on every piece of furniture in the house. Plus, an energetic cat threatens to harm a toddler.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Investigators recall their work in the aftermath of Hurricane Rita, when the Houston SPCA launched one of the biggest animal rescue operations America has seen.

programme.title: Long Lost Family Australia
programme.desc: Chrissie Swan and Anh Do host a heart-warming, emotional series shining a light on incredible true stories of people who have long sought out lost family members. Cancer sufferer Ray Hawkins is searching for his daughter, whom he abandoned during a difficult time over 40 years ago.

programme.title: Faking It: Tears of a Crime
programme.desc: When April Barber was murdered at a remote Florida beauty spot, her husband Justin said he tried to stop the killer and even appealed for help on television. Experts analyse the deception in his words and deeds of August 2002.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Shantel hardly sees her brother Carlton, who lives downstairs. At over 600lbs each neither can use the stairs, so Dr Now sets out to fix their co-dependent eating.
